DataElement.preferredName: Tobacco Smoking in Television and Movie Exposure Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, used for smoking, chewing, or snuff.  Tobacco contains nicotine, a stimulant, and other biologically active ingredients having carcinogenic properties._The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe._Television (CTV/PTV)_A sequence of images displayed in succession giving the illusion of continuous movement._The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, dried and prepared for smoking or ingestion.
